use.flag:
Auto resolves firmware and kernel version required for full mitigation, instead of manually selecting microarchitecture which determines the minimum requirements for those 2 items which benefits mostly LTS configurations.
This is recommended for Intel® CPUs since the USE flag coverage for microarchitectures is incomplete.
Prevent vendor lock-in when doing kernel mitigation checks.
Protect against data tampering by replacing vulnerable versions.
Use firmware as mitigation. (A BIOS firmware update from the motherboard manufacturer may still be required if the firmware package doesn't apply to your model.)
Mitigate against data tampering, privilege escalation, Spectre V1, Spectre V2 for the NVIDIA® video driver.

Bump to the latest patched kernel point releases when the changelog indicated fixed data tampering (DT) class of vulnerabilities. This will increase the coverage of DT mitigation for the installed kernels significantly because the USE flag coverage is incomplete or the vulnerability report doesn't clearly state the types of vulnerabilities.
